Projects.project: 1. Research Projects done at the Indian Institute of Technology, Mumbai (IIT Bombay) (July 1999-July 2003). The research projects undertaken are given below. (a) Solar Dryer (b) Contacting Device (India Patent) (c) Energy Efficient Regeneration Process (International Patent) (d) Liquid Desiccant Based Dryer (LDBD) (e) Hybrid Cooling System (India Patent) Funding Agencies: Prominent Industries and IIT Bombay.

2. Post-Doctoral Research Projects done at Fr. C. Rodrigues Institute of Technology, Navi Mumbai, India. The research projects undertaken are given below. (a) Energy Conservation in Window Air Conditioner (May 2003- June 2004): Funding Agency: ISHRAE (Indian Society of Heating, Refrigerating and Air Conditioning Engineers), Mumbai Chapter. (b) Experimentation on Window Air Conditioner with Speed Control Circuit (July 2004-June 2005): Funding Agency: ISHRAE (Indian Society of Heating, Refrigerating and Air Conditioning Engineers), Mumbai Chapter. (c) Hybrid Cooling System (HCS) (2006-08): This project won the National Award for Rs. 50,000/-for Excellence in HVAC&R instituted by Bry-Air Asia Pvt. Ltd., Gurgaon in the year

3. The future work is to design, fabricate and test an energy-efficient HACS. Funding Agency: Fr. C. Rodrigues Institute of Technology, Navi Mumbai. (d) Heat Pump Assisted Dryer (HPAD) (June 2006-May 2008): This project won the National Award for Rs. 1,00,000/-for Excellence in HVAC&R instituted by Bry-Air Asia Pvt. Ltd., Gurgaon in the year

4. The future work is to design, fabricate and test a multipurpose dryer cum cold store. Funding Agency: Fr. C. Rodrigues Institute of Technology, Navi Mumbai. (e) Plastic Solar Water Heater (PSWH) (June 2006- May 2008): The prototype won the Meritorious Award at KAIF 2007, a State level project exhibition organized by TATA Power, Mumbai. Funding Agencies: University of Mumbai and Fr. C. Rodrigues Institute of Technology.

5. Research Work at Manipal Academy Higher Education (MAHE) Dubai Campus. (a) Solar Liquid Desiccant Air Conditioning System (SLDACS) (June 2011 – May 2013): Funding Agency: ASHRAE (American Society of Heating, Refrigerating and Air Conditioning Engineers) (b) Direct Exchange Ground Source Heat Exchanger (DXGSHE) (July 2013 – June 2014): Funding Agency: ASHRAE (American Society of Heating, Refrigerating and Air Conditioning Engineers) (c) Solar Solid Desiccant Air Conditioning System (July 2015 – June 2016): Funding Agency: ASHRAE (American Society of Heating, Refrigerating and Air Conditioning Engineers) (d) Development of a Solar Desalination System Assisted by Thermoacoustic Cooling (July 2018 – June 2019) Funding Agency: ASHRAE (American Society of Heating, Refrigerating and Air Conditioning Engineers) (e) Study on the Design, Fabrication and Performance Assessment of a Multistage Reciprocating Humidification and Dehumidification System (July 2018 – November 2020) Funding Agency: ASHRAE (American Society of Heating, Refrigerating and Air Conditioning Engineers) (f) Design, Development and Testing of Novel Solar Water Heater (July 2019 – November 2020) Funding Agency: ECOVAL Solar Lab, Dubai, UAE Design and Development of Prosthetics and Orthotics for Humans & Animals (POHA) – (January 2024 onwards).
